IntegrationName.documentation: A unique name for an integration in Glue.

SourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the source for the integration.

TargetArn.documentation: The ARN of the target for the integration.

IntegrationName.documentation: A unique name for an integration in Glue.

IntegrationArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the integration.

KmsKeyId.documentation: The ARN of a KMS key used for encrypting the channel.

AdditionalEncryptionContext.documentation: An optional set of non-secret keyvalue pairs that contains additional contextual information for encryption.

Tags.documentation: Metadata assigned to the resource consisting of a list of key-value pairs.

Status.documentation:
The status of the integration being modified.

The possible statuses are:

  • CREATING: The integration is being created.

  • ACTIVE: The integration creation succeeds.

  • MODIFYING: The integration is being modified.

  • FAILED: The integration creation fails.

  • DELETING: The integration is deleted.

  • SYNCING: The integration is synchronizing.

  • NEEDS_ATTENTION: The integration needs attention, such as synchronization.

CreateTime.documentation: The time when the integration was created, in UTC.

Errors.documentation: A list of errors associated with the integration modification.

DataFilter.documentation: Selects source tables for the integration using Maxwell filter syntax.

ConnectionName.documentation: The name of the connection to use to connect to the Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB target.

Path.documentation: The path of the Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB target (database/collection).

ScanAll.documentation:
Indicates whether to scan all the records, or to sample rows from the table. Scanning all the records can take a long time when the table is not a high throughput table.

A value of true means to scan all records, while a value of false means to sample the records. If no value is specified, the value defaults to true.

MongoDBTarget.documentation: Specifies an Amazon DocumentDB or MongoDB data store to crawl.

CrawlerDetails.documentation: Details of the crawler when the node represents a crawler.

Node.documentation: A node represents an Glue component (trigger, crawler, or job) on a workflow graph.

NotifyDelayAfter.documentation: After a job run starts, the number of minutes to wait before sending a job run delay notification.

IsEmpty.documentation: Specifies that an empty string is considered as a null value.

IsNullString.documentation: Specifies that a value spelling out the word 'null' is considered as a null value.

IsNegOne.documentation: Specifies that an integer value of -1 is considered as a null value.

NullCheckBoxList.documentation: Represents whether certain values are recognized as null values for removal.

NullValueField.documentation: Represents a custom null value such as a zeros or other value being used as a null placeholder unique to the dataset.

AWSManagedClientApplicationReference.documentation: The reference to the SaaS-side client app that is Amazon Web Services managed.

OAuth2ClientApplication.documentation: The OAuth2 client app used for the connection.

UserManagedClientApplicationClientSecret.documentation: The client application client secret if the client application is user managed.

RefreshToken.documentation: The refresh token used when the authentication type is OAuth2.

JwtToken.documentation: The JSON Web Token (JWT) used when the authentication type is OAuth2.

OAuth2Credentials.documentation: The credentials used when the authentication type is OAuth2 authentication.

OAuth2GrantType.documentation: The OAuth2 grant type. For example, AUTHORIZATION_CODE, JWT_BEARER, or CLIENT_CREDENTIALS.

OAuth2ClientApplication.documentation: The client application type. For example, AWS_MANAGED or USER_MANAGED.

TokenUrlParametersMap.documentation: A map of parameters that are added to the token GET request.

OAuth2Properties.documentation: A structure containing properties for OAuth2 authentication.

OAuth2ClientApplication.documentation: The client application type in the CreateConnection request. For example, AWS_MANAGED or USER_MANAGED.

OAuth2Credentials.documentation: The credentials used when the authentication type is OAuth2 authentication.

OAuth2PropertiesInput.documentation: A structure containing properties for OAuth2 in the CreateConnection request.

SortOrder.documentation: Indicates that the column is sorted in ascending order (== 1), or in descending order (==0).

Order.documentation: Specifies the sort order of a sorted column.

icebergConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for an Iceberg orphan file deletion optimizer.

OrphanFileDeletionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for an orphan file deletion optimizer.

IcebergMetrics.documentation: A structure containing the Iceberg orphan file deletion metrics for the optimizer run.

OrphanFileDeletionMetrics.documentation: A structure that contains orphan file deletion metrics for the optimizer run.

MetadataValue.documentation: The metadata keys corresponding value for the other metadata belonging to the same metadata key.

CreatedTime.documentation: The time at which the entry was created.

OtherMetadataValueListItem.documentation: A structure containing other metadata for a schema version belonging to the same metadata key.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The node ID inputs to the transform.

EntityTypesToDetect.documentation:
Indicates the types of entities the PIIDetection transform will identify as PII data.

PII type entities include: PERSON_NAME, DATE, USA_SNN, EMAIL, USA_ITIN, USA_PASSPORT_NUMBER, PHONE_NUMBER, BANK_ACCOUNT, IP_ADDRESS, MAC_ADDRESS, USA_CPT_CODE, USA_HCPCS_CODE, USA_NATIONAL_DRUG_CODE, USA_MEDICARE_BENEFICIARY_IDENTIFIER, USA_HEALTH_INSURANCE_CLAIM_NUMBER,CREDIT_CARD,USA_NATIONAL_PROVIDER_IDENTIFIER,USA_DEA_NUMBER,USA_DRIVING_LICENSE

OutputColumnName.documentation: Indicates the output column name that will contain any entity type detected in that row.

SampleFraction.documentation: Indicates the fraction of the data to sample when scanning for PII entities.

ThresholdFraction.documentation: Indicates the fraction of the data that must be met in order for a column to be identified as PII data.

MaskValue.documentation: Indicates the value that will replace the detected entity.

RedactText.documentation: Specifies whether to redact the detected PII text. When set to true, PII content is replaced with redaction characters.

RedactChar.documentation: The character used to replace detected PII content when redaction is enabled. The default redaction character is *.

MatchPattern.documentation: A regular expression pattern used to identify additional PII content beyond the standard detection algorithms.

NumLeftCharsToExclude.documentation: The number of characters to exclude from redaction on the left side of detected PII content. This allows preserving context around the sensitive data.

NumRightCharsToExclude.documentation: The number of characters to exclude from redaction on the right side of detected PII content. This allows preserving context around the sensitive data.

DetectionParameters.documentation: Additional parameters for configuring PII detection behavior and sensitivity settings.

DetectionSensitivity.documentation: The sensitivity level for PII detection. Higher sensitivity levels detect more potential PII but may result in more false positives.

PIIDetection.documentation: Specifies a transform that identifies, removes or masks PII data.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the catalog database in which to create the partition.

TableName.documentation: The name of the database table in which to create the partition.

CreationTime.documentation: The time at which the partition was created.

LastAccessTime.documentation: The last time at which the partition was accessed.

StorageDescriptor.documentation: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

LastAnalyzedTime.documentation: The last time at which column statistics were computed for this partition.

CatalogId.documentation: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the partition resides.

Keys.documentation: A list of one or more keys, as KeySchemaElement structures, for the partition index.

IndexStatus.documentation:
The status of the partition index.

The possible statuses are:

  • CREATING: The index is being created. When an index is in a CREATING state, the index or its table cannot be deleted.

  • ACTIVE: The index creation succeeds.

  • FAILED: The index creation fails.

  • DELETING: The index is deleted from the list of indexes.

BackfillErrors.documentation: A list of errors that can occur when registering partition indexes for an existing table.

PartitionIndexDescriptor.documentation: A descriptor for a partition index in a table.

Values.documentation:
The values of the partition. Although this parameter is not required by the SDK, you must specify this parameter for a valid input.

The values for the keys for the new partition must be passed as an array of String objects that must be ordered in the same order as the partition keys appearing in the Amazon S3 prefix. Otherwise Glue will add the values to the wrong keys.

LastAccessTime.documentation: The last time at which the partition was accessed.

StorageDescriptor.documentation: Provides information about the physical location where the partition is stored.

LastAnalyzedTime.documentation: The last time at which column statistics were computed for this partition.

PartitionInput.documentation: The structure used to create and update a partition.

PartitionValueList.documentation: Contains a list of values defining partitions.

Message.documentation: There is a mismatch between the SupportedPermissionType used in the query request and the permissions defined on the target table.

SubnetId.documentation: The subnet ID used by the connection.

SecurityGroupIdList.documentation: The security group ID list used by the connection.

PhysicalConnectionRequirements.documentation: The OAuth client app in GetConnection response.

Name.documentation: The name of the data source.

Database.documentation: The name of the database to read from.

Table.documentation: The name of the table in the database to read from.

Inputs.documentation: The nodes that are inputs to the data target.

Database.documentation: The name of the database to write to.

Table.documentation: The name of the table in the database to write to.

PostgreSQLCatalogTarget.documentation: Specifies a target that uses Postgres SQL.

PreProcessingQueryString.documentation: SQL Query of SparkSQL format that can be used to pre-process data before running Data Quality Operations.

JobName.documentation: The name of the job definition used by the predecessor job run.

RunId.documentation: The job-run ID of the predecessor job run.

Predecessor.documentation: A job run that was used in the predicate of a conditional trigger that triggered this job run.

Logical.documentation: An optional field if only one condition is listed. If multiple conditions are listed, then this field is required.

Conditions.documentation: A list of the conditions that determine when the trigger will fire.

Predicate.documentation: Defines the predicate of the trigger, which determines when it fires.

Permissions.documentation: The permissions that are granted to the principal.

SessionConfiguration.documentation: A key-value map of configuration parameters for Glue sessions.

JobConfiguration.documentation: A key-value map of configuration parameters for Glue jobs.

ProfileConfiguration.documentation: Specifies the job and session values that an admin configures in an Glue usage profile.

Name.documentation: The name of the property.

AllowedValues.documentation: A list of AllowedValue objects representing the values allowed for the property.

DataOperationScopes.documentation: Indicates which data operations are applicable to the property.

Property.documentation: An object that defines a connection type for a compute environment.

Comparator.documentation: The comparator used to compare this property to others.

CatalogId.documentation: The ID of the Data Catalog to set the security configuration for. If none is provided, the Amazon Web Services account ID is used by default.

ProfileId.documentation: The ID of the data quality monitoring profile to annotate.

InclusionAnnotation.documentation: The inclusion annotation value to apply to the profile.

PolicyInJson.documentation: Contains the policy document to set, in JSON format.

ResourceArn.documentation: Do not use. For internal use only.

PolicyHashCondition.documentation: The hash value returned when the previous policy was set using PutResourcePolicy. Its purpose is to prevent concurrent modifications of a policy. Do not use this parameter if no previous policy has been set.

PolicyExistsCondition.documentation: A value of MUST_EXIST is used to update a policy. A value of NOT_EXIST is used to create a new policy. If a value of NONE or a null value is used, the call does not depend on the existence of a policy.

EnableHybrid.documentation:
If 'TRUE', indicates that you are using both methods to grant cross-account access to Data Catalog resources:

  • By directly updating the resource policy with PutResourePolicy

  • By using the Grant permissions command on the Amazon Web Services Management Console.

Must be set to 'TRUE' if you have already used the Management Console to grant cross-account access, otherwise the call fails. Default is 'FALSE'.

PolicyHash.documentation: A hash of the policy that has just been set. This must be included in a subsequent call that overwrites or updates this policy.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique version ID of the schema version.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the schema.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique version ID of the schema version.

Name.documentation: Name of the workflow which was run.

RunId.documentation: The ID of the workflow run for which the run properties should be updated.

RunProperties.documentation:
The properties to put for the specified run.

Run properties may be logged. Do not pass plaintext secrets as properties. Retrieve secrets from a Glue Connection, Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager or other secret management mechanism if you intend to use them within the workflow run.

SchemaId.documentation: A wrapper structure that may contain the schema name and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique version ID of the schema version.

MetadataList.documentation: Search key-value pairs for metadata, if they are not provided all the metadata information will be fetched.

MaxResults.documentation: Maximum number of results required per page. If the value is not supplied, this will be defaulted to 25 per page.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique version ID of the schema version.

NextToken.documentation: A continuation token for paginating the returned list of tokens, returned if the current segment of the list is not the last.

QueryId.documentation: A unique identifier generated by the query engine for the query.

QueryStartTime.documentation: A timestamp provided by the query engine for when the query started.

ClusterId.documentation: An identifier string for the consumer cluster.

QueryAuthorizationId.documentation: A cryptographically generated query identifier generated by Glue or Lake Formation.

AdditionalContext.documentation: An opaque string-string map passed by the query engine.

QuerySessionContext.documentation: A structure used as a protocol between query engines and Lake Formation or Glue. Contains both a Lake Formation generated authorization identifier and information from the request's authorization context.

Recipe.documentation: A Glue Studio node that uses a Glue DataBrew recipe in Glue jobs.

RecipeAction.documentation: Actions defined in the Glue Studio data preparation recipe node.

RecipeReference.documentation: A reference to a Glue DataBrew recipe.

Action.documentation: The transformation action of the recipe step.

ConditionExpressions.documentation: The condition expressions for the recipe step.

RecipeStep.documentation: A recipe step used in a Glue Studio data preparation recipe node.

RecrawlBehavior.documentation:
Specifies whether to crawl the entire dataset again or to crawl only folders that were added since the last crawler run.

A value of CRAWL_EVERYTHING specifies crawling the entire dataset again.

A value of CRAWL_NEW_FOLDERS_ONLY specifies crawling only folders that were added since the last crawler run.

A value of CRAWL_EVENT_MODE specifies crawling only the changes identified by Amazon S3 events.

RecrawlPolicy.documentation: When crawling an Amazon S3 data source after the first crawl is complete, specifies whether to crawl the entire dataset again or to crawl only folders that were added since the last crawler run. For more information, see Incremental Crawls in Glue in the developer guide.

Name.documentation: The name of the Amazon Redshift data store.

Database.documentation: The database to read from.

Table.documentation: The database table to read from.

RedshiftTmpDir.documentation: The Amazon S3 path where temporary data can be staged when copying out of the database.

SchemaId.documentation:
This is a wrapper structure to contain schema identity fields. The structure contains:

  • SchemaId$SchemaArn: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema. Either SchemaArn or SchemaName and RegistryName has to be provided.

  • SchemaId$SchemaName: The name of the schema. Either SchemaArn or SchemaName and RegistryName has to be provided.

SchemaDefinition.documentation: The schema definition using the DataFormat setting for the SchemaName.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique ID that represents the version of this schema.

VersionNumber.documentation: The version of this schema (for sync flow only, in case this is the first version).

RegistryName.documentation: Name of the registry. Used only for lookup. One of RegistryArn or RegistryName has to be provided.

RegistryArn.documentation: Arn of the registry to be updated. One of RegistryArn or RegistryName has to be provided.

RegistryId.documentation: A wrapper structure that may contain the registry name and Amazon Resource Name (ARN).

RegistryArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the registry.

RegistryListItem.documentation: A structure containing the details for a registry.

JobName.documentation: The name of the job in question.

ResourceNotReadyException.documentation: A resource was not ready for a transaction.

RunId.documentation: The ID of the workflow run to resume.

NodeIds.documentation: A list of the node IDs for the nodes you want to restart. The nodes that are to be restarted must have a run attempt in the original run.

RunId.documentation: The new ID assigned to the resumed workflow run. Each resume of a workflow run will have a new run ID.

NodeIds.documentation: A list of the node IDs for the nodes that were actually restarted.

icebergConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for an Iceberg snapshot retention optimizer.

RetentionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for a snapshot retention optimizer.

IcebergMetrics.documentation: A structure containing the Iceberg retention metrics for the optimizer run.

RetentionMetrics.documentation: A structure that contains retention metrics for the optimizer run.

Name.documentation: The name of the route node.

Inputs.documentation: The input connection for the route node.

GroupFiltersList.documentation: A list of group filters that define the routing conditions and criteria for directing data to different output paths.

Route.documentation: Specifies a route node that directs data to different output paths based on defined filtering conditions.

RunId.documentation: The Run ID.

NumberOfBytesCompacted.documentation: The number of bytes removed by the compaction job run.

NumberOfFilesCompacted.documentation: The number of files removed by the compaction job run.

NumberOfDpus.documentation: The number of DPUs consumed by the job, rounded up to the nearest whole number.

JobDurationInHour.documentation: The duration of the job in hours.

RunMetrics.documentation:
Metrics for the optimizer run.

This structure is deprecated. See the individual metric members for compaction, retention, and orphan file deletion.

SessionId.documentation: The Session Id of the statement to be run.

Id.documentation: Returns the Id of the statement that was run.

PartitionPredicate.documentation: Partitions satisfying this predicate are deleted. Files within the retention period in these partitions are not deleted. Set to "" empty by default.

Name.documentation: The name of the data store.

Paths.documentation: A list of the Amazon S3 paths to read from.

CompressionType.documentation: Specifies how the data is compressed. This is generally not necessary if the data has a standard file extension. Possible values are "gzip" and "bzip").

Exclusions.documentation: A string containing a JSON list of Unix-style glob patterns to exclude. For example, "[\"**.pdf\"]" excludes all PDF files.

GroupSize.documentation: The target group size in bytes. The default is computed based on the input data size and the size of your cluster. When there are fewer than 50,000 input files, "groupFiles" must be set to "inPartition" for this to take effect.

GroupFiles.documentation: Grouping files is turned on by default when the input contains more than 50,000 files. To turn on grouping with fewer than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "inPartition". To disable grouping when there are more than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "none".

Recurse.documentation: If set to true, recursively reads files in all subdirectories under the specified paths.

MaxBand.documentation: This option controls the duration in milliseconds after which the s3 listing is likely to be consistent. Files with modification timestamps falling within the last maxBand milliseconds are tracked specially when using JobBookmarks to account for Amazon S3 eventual consistency. Most users don't need to set this option. The default is 900000 milliseconds, or 15 minutes.

MaxFilesInBand.documentation: This option specifies the maximum number of files to save from the last maxBand seconds. If this number is exceeded, extra files are skipped and only processed in the next job run.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Specifies additional connection options.

Separator.documentation: Specifies the delimiter character. The default is a comma: ",", but any other character can be specified.

Escaper.documentation: Specifies a character to use for escaping. This option is used only when reading CSV files. The default value is none. If enabled, the character which immediately follows is used as-is, except for a small set of well-known escapes (\n, \r, \t, and \0).

QuoteChar.documentation: Specifies the character to use for quoting. The default is a double quote: '"'. Set this to -1 to turn off quoting entirely.

Multiline.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether a single record can span multiple lines. This can occur when a field contains a quoted new-line character. You must set this option to True if any record spans multiple lines. The default value is False, which allows for more aggressive file-splitting during parsing.

WithHeader.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether to treat the first line as a header. The default value is False.

WriteHeader.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether to write the header to output. The default value is True.

SkipFirst.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether to skip the first data line. The default value is False.

OptimizePerformance.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether to use the advanced SIMD CSV reader along with Apache Arrow based columnar memory formats. Only available in Glue version 3.0.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies the data schema for the S3 CSV source.

S3CsvSource.documentation: Specifies a command-separated value (CSV) data store stored in Amazon S3.

Exclusions.documentation: A string containing a JSON list of Unix-style glob patterns to exclude. For example, "[\"**.pdf\"]" excludes all PDF files.

GroupSize.documentation: The target group size in bytes. The default is computed based on the input data size and the size of your cluster. When there are fewer than 50,000 input files, "groupFiles" must be set to "inPartition" for this to take effect.

GroupFiles.documentation: Grouping files is turned on by default when the input contains more than 50,000 files. To turn on grouping with fewer than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "inPartition". To disable grouping when there are more than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "none".

Recurse.documentation: If set to true, recursively reads files in all subdirectories under the specified paths.

MaxBand.documentation: This option controls the duration in milliseconds after which the s3 listing is likely to be consistent. Files with modification timestamps falling within the last maxBand milliseconds are tracked specially when using JobBookmarks to account for Amazon S3 eventual consistency. Most users don't need to set this option. The default is 900000 milliseconds, or 15 minutes.

MaxFilesInBand.documentation: This option specifies the maximum number of files to save from the last maxBand seconds. If this number is exceeded, extra files are skipped and only processed in the next job run.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Specifies additional connection options.

JsonPath.documentation: A JsonPath string defining the JSON data.

Multiline.documentation: A Boolean value that specifies whether a single record can span multiple lines. This can occur when a field contains a quoted new-line character. You must set this option to True if any record spans multiple lines. The default value is False, which allows for more aggressive file-splitting during parsing.

Paths.documentation: A list of the Amazon S3 paths to read from.

Exclusions.documentation: A string containing a JSON list of Unix-style glob patterns to exclude. For example, "[\"**.pdf\"]" excludes all PDF files.

GroupSize.documentation: The target group size in bytes. The default is computed based on the input data size and the size of your cluster. When there are fewer than 50,000 input files, "groupFiles" must be set to "inPartition" for this to take effect.

GroupFiles.documentation: Grouping files is turned on by default when the input contains more than 50,000 files. To turn on grouping with fewer than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "inPartition". To disable grouping when there are more than 50,000 files, set this parameter to "none".

Recurse.documentation: If set to true, recursively reads files in all subdirectories under the specified paths.

MaxBand.documentation: This option controls the duration in milliseconds after which the s3 listing is likely to be consistent. Files with modification timestamps falling within the last maxBand milliseconds are tracked specially when using JobBookmarks to account for Amazon S3 eventual consistency. Most users don't need to set this option. The default is 900000 milliseconds, or 15 minutes.

MaxFilesInBand.documentation: This option specifies the maximum number of files to save from the last maxBand seconds. If this number is exceeded, extra files are skipped and only processed in the next job run.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Specifies additional connection options.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies the data schema for the S3 Parquet source.

S3ParquetSource.documentation: Specifies an Apache Parquet data store stored in Amazon S3.

BoundedSize.documentation: Sets the upper limit for the target size of the dataset in bytes that will be processed.

BoundedFiles.documentation: Sets the upper limit for the target number of files that will be processed.

S3SourceAdditionalOptions.documentation: Specifies additional connection options for the Amazon S3 data store.

Path.documentation: The path to the Amazon S3 target.

Exclusions.documentation: A list of glob patterns used to exclude from the crawl. For more information, see Catalog Tables with a Crawler.

ConnectionName.documentation: The name of a connection which allows a job or crawler to access data in Amazon S3 within an Amazon Virtual Private Cloud environment (Amazon VPC).

SampleSize.documentation: Sets the number of files in each leaf folder to be crawled when crawling sample files in a dataset. If not set, all the files are crawled. A valid value is an integer between 1 and 249.

EventQueueArn.documentation: A valid Amazon SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:sqs.

DlqEventQueueArn.documentation: A valid Amazon dead-letter SQS ARN. For example, arn:aws:sqs:region:account:deadLetterQueue.

S3Target.documentation: Specifies a data store in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3).

ScheduleExpression.documentation: A cron expression used to specify the schedule (see Time-Based Schedules for Jobs and Crawlers. For example, to run something every day at 12:15 UTC, you would specify: cron(15 12 * * ? *).

Schedule.documentation: A scheduling object using a cron statement to schedule an event.

UpdateBehavior.documentation: The update behavior when the crawler finds a changed schema.

DeleteBehavior.documentation: The deletion behavior when the crawler finds a deleted object.

SchemaChangePolicy.documentation: A policy that specifies update and deletion behaviors for the crawler.

Name.documentation: The name of the column.

DataType.documentation: The type of data in the column.

SchemaColumn.documentation: A key-value pair representing a column and data type that this transform can run against. The Schema parameter of the MLTransform may contain up to 100 of these structures.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema. One of SchemaArn or SchemaName has to be provided.

SchemaName.documentation: The name of the schema. One of SchemaArn or SchemaName has to be provided.

RegistryName.documentation: The name of the schema registry that contains the schema.

SchemaId.documentation: The unique ID of the schema in the Glue schema registry.

RegistryName.documentation: the name of the registry where the schema resides.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the schema.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time that a schema was created.

UpdatedTime.documentation: The date and time that a schema was updated.

SchemaListItem.documentation: An object that contains minimal details for a schema.

SchemaId.documentation: A structure that contains schema identity fields. Either this or the SchemaVersionId has to be provided.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique ID assigned to a version of the schema. Either this or the SchemaId has to be provided.

SchemaReference.documentation: An object that references a schema stored in the Glue Schema Registry.

ErrorDetails.documentation: The details of the error for the schema version.

SchemaVersionErrorItem.documentation: An object that contains the error details for an operation on a schema version.

SchemaArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the schema.

SchemaVersionId.documentation: The unique identifier of the schema version.

CreatedTime.documentation: The date and time the schema version was created.

SchemaVersionListItem.documentation: An object containing the details about a schema version.

LatestVersion.documentation: The latest version available for the schema.

SchemaVersionNumber.documentation: A structure containing the schema version information.

CatalogId.documentation: A unique identifier, consisting of account_id .

NextToken.documentation: A continuation token, included if this is a continuation call.

Filters.documentation:
A list of key-value pairs, and a comparator used to filter the search results. Returns all entities matching the predicate.

The Comparator member of the PropertyPredicate struct is used only for time fields, and can be omitted for other field types. Also, when comparing string values, such as when Key=Name, a fuzzy match algorithm is used. The Key field (for example, the value of the Name field) is split on certain punctuation characters, for example, -, :, #, etc. into tokens. Then each token is exact-match compared with the Value member of PropertyPredicate. For example, if Key=Name and Value=link, tables named customer-link and xx-link-yy are returned, but xxlinkyy is not returned.

SearchText.documentation:
A string used for a text search.

Specifying a value in quotes filters based on an exact match to the value.

SortCriteria.documentation: A list of criteria for sorting the results by a field name, in an ascending or descending order.

MaxResults.documentation: The maximum number of tables to return in a single response.

ResourceShareType.documentation:
Allows you to specify that you want to search the tables shared with your account. The allowable values are FOREIGN or ALL.

  • If set to FOREIGN, will search the tables shared with your account.

  • If set to ALL, will search the tables shared with your account, as well as the tables in yor local account.

IncludeStatusDetails.documentation: Specifies whether to include status details related to a request to create or update an Glue Data Catalog view.

NextToken.documentation: A continuation token, present if the current list segment is not the last.

TableList.documentation: A list of the requested Table objects. The SearchTables response returns only the tables that you have access to.

Name.documentation: The name of the security configuration.

CreatedTimeStamp.documentation: The time at which this security configuration was created.

EncryptionConfiguration.documentation: The encryption configuration associated with this security configuration.

SegmentNumber.documentation: The zero-based index number of the segment. For example, if the total number of segments is 4, SegmentNumber values range from 0 through 3.

Segment.documentation: Defines a non-overlapping region of a table's partitions, allowing multiple requests to be run in parallel.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The data inputs identified by their node names.

Paths.documentation: A JSON path to a variable in the data structure.

SelectFields.documentation: Specifies a transform that chooses the data property keys that you want to keep.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The data inputs identified by their node names.

Index.documentation: The index for the DynamicFrame to be selected.

SelectFromCollection.documentation: Specifies a transform that chooses one DynamicFrame from a collection of DynamicFrames. The output is the selected DynamicFrame

Name.documentation: Name of the SerDe.

SerializationLibrary.documentation: Usually the class that implements the SerDe. An example is org.apache.hadoop.hive.serde2.columnar.ColumnarSerDe.

Parameters.documentation: These key-value pairs define initialization parameters for the SerDe.

SerDeInfo.documentation: Information about a serialization/deserialization program (SerDe) that serves as an extractor and loader.

CreatedOn.documentation: The time and date when the session was created.

ErrorMessage.documentation: The error message displayed during the session.

Role.documentation: The name or Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM role associated with the Session.

DefaultArguments.documentation: A map array of key-value pairs. Max is 75 pairs.

Connections.documentation: The number of connections used for the session.

Progress.documentation: The code execution progress of the session.

MaxCapacity.documentation: The number of Glue data processing units (DPUs) that can be allocated when the job runs. A DPU is a relative measure of processing power that consists of 4 vCPUs of compute capacity and 16 GB memory.

SecurityConfiguration.documentation: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with the session.

GlueVersion.documentation: The Glue version determines the versions of Apache Spark and Python that Glue supports. The GlueVersion must be greater than 2.0.

NumberOfWorkers.documentation: The number of workers of a defined WorkerType to use for the session.

WorkerType.documentation: The type of predefined worker that is allocated when a session runs. Accepts a value of G.1X, G.2X, G.4X, or G.8X for Spark sessions. Accepts the value Z.2X for Ray sessions.

CompletedOn.documentation: The date and time that this session is completed.

ExecutionTime.documentation: The total time the session ran for.

DPUSeconds.documentation: The DPUs consumed by the session (formula: ExecutionTime * MaxCapacity).

IdleTimeout.documentation: The number of minutes when idle before the session times out.

ProfileName.documentation: The name of an Glue usage profile associated with the session.

Session.documentation: The period in which a remote Spark runtime environment is running.

Name.documentation: Specifies the name of the SessionCommand. Can be 'glueetl' or 'gluestreaming'.

PythonVersion.documentation: Specifies the Python version. The Python version indicates the version supported for jobs of type Spark.

SkewedColumnNames.documentation: A list of names of columns that contain skewed values.

SkewedColumnValues.documentation: A list of values that appear so frequently as to be considered skewed.

SkewedColumnValueLocationMaps.documentation: A mapping of skewed values to the columns that contain them.

SkewedInfo.documentation: Specifies skewed values in a table. Skewed values are those that occur with very high frequency.

SourceType.documentation: Specifies how retrieved data is specified. Valid values: "table", "query".

Connection.documentation: Specifies a Glue Data Catalog Connection to a Snowflake endpoint.

Schema.documentation: Specifies a Snowflake database schema for your node to use.

Table.documentation: Specifies a Snowflake table for your node to use.

Database.documentation: Specifies a Snowflake database for your node to use.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Specifies additional options passed to the Snowflake connector. If options are specified elsewhere in this node, this will take precedence.

SampleQuery.documentation: A SQL string used to retrieve data with the query sourcetype.

PreAction.documentation: A SQL string run before the Snowflake connector performs its standard actions.

PostAction.documentation: A SQL string run after the Snowflake connector performs its standard actions.

Action.documentation: Specifies what action to take when writing to a table with preexisting data. Valid values: append, merge, truncate, drop.

Upsert.documentation: Used when Action is append. Specifies the resolution behavior when a row already exists. If true, preexisting rows will be updated. If false, those rows will be inserted.

MergeAction.documentation: Specifies a merge action. Valid values: simple, custom. If simple, merge behavior is defined by MergeWhenMatched and MergeWhenNotMatched. If custom, defined by MergeClause.

MergeWhenMatched.documentation: Specifies how to resolve records that match preexisting data when merging. Valid values: update, delete.

MergeWhenNotMatched.documentation: Specifies how to process records that do not match preexisting data when merging. Valid values: insert, none.

MergeClause.documentation: A SQL statement that specifies a custom merge behavior.

StagingTable.documentation: The name of a staging table used when performing merge or upsert append actions. Data is written to this table, then moved to table by a generated postaction.

SelectedColumns.documentation: Specifies the columns combined to identify a record when detecting matches for merges and upserts. A list of structures with value, label and description keys. Each structure describes a column.

AutoPushdown.documentation: Specifies whether automatic query pushdown is enabled. If pushdown is enabled, then when a query is run on Spark, if part of the query can be "pushed down" to the Snowflake server, it is pushed down. This improves performance of some queries.

TableSchema.documentation: Manually defines the target schema for the node. A list of structures with value , label and description keys. Each structure defines a column.

SnowflakeNodeData.documentation: Specifies configuration for Snowflake nodes in Glue Studio.

Name.documentation: The name of the Snowflake data source.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies user-defined schemas for your output data.

Name.documentation: The name of the Snowflake target.

Data.documentation: Specifies the data of the Snowflake target node.

Inputs.documentation: The nodes that are inputs to the data target.

FieldName.documentation: The name of the field on which to sort.

SortCriterion.documentation: Specifies a field to sort by and a sort order.

Repository.documentation: The name of the remote repository that contains the job artifacts.

Owner.documentation: The owner of the remote repository that contains the job artifacts.

Branch.documentation: An optional branch in the remote repository.

Folder.documentation: An optional folder in the remote repository.

LastCommitId.documentation: The last commit ID for a commit in the remote repository.

AuthStrategy.documentation: The type of authentication, which can be an authentication token stored in Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager, or a personal access token.

SourceControlDetails.documentation: The details for a source control configuration for a job, allowing synchronization of job artifacts to or from a remote repository.

RoleArn.documentation: The IAM role to access the Glue connection.

SourceProcessingProperties.documentation: The resource properties associated with the integration source.

Fields.documentation: A list of fields used for column-level filtering. Currently unsupported.

FilterPredicate.documentation: A condition clause used for row-level filtering. Currently unsupported.

PrimaryKey.documentation: Provide the primary key set for this table. Currently supported specifically for SAP EntityOf entities upon request. Contact Amazon Web Services Support to make this feature available.

SourceTableConfig.documentation: Properties used by the source leg to process data from the source.

Name.documentation: The name of the data source.

ConnectionName.documentation: The name of the connection that is associated with the connector.

ConnectorName.documentation: The name of a connector that assists with accessing the data store in Glue Studio.

ConnectionType.documentation: The type of connection, such as marketplace.spark or custom.spark, designating a connection to an Apache Spark data store.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Additional connection options for the connector.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies data schema for the custom spark source.

SparkConnectorSource.documentation: Specifies a connector to an Apache Spark data source.

Name.documentation: The name of the data target.

Inputs.documentation: The nodes that are inputs to the data target.

ConnectionName.documentation: The name of a connection for an Apache Spark connector.

ConnectorName.documentation: The name of an Apache Spark connector.

ConnectionType.documentation: The type of connection, such as marketplace.spark or custom.spark, designating a connection to an Apache Spark data store.

AdditionalOptions.documentation: Additional connection options for the connector.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies the data schema for the custom spark target.

SparkConnectorTarget.documentation: Specifies a target that uses an Apache Spark connector.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The data inputs identified by their node names. You can associate a table name with each input node to use in the SQL query. The name you choose must meet the Spark SQL naming restrictions.

SqlQuery.documentation: A SQL query that must use Spark SQL syntax and return a single data set.

SqlAliases.documentation:
A list of aliases. An alias allows you to specify what name to use in the SQL for a given input. For example, you have a datasource named "MyDataSource". If you specify From as MyDataSource, and Alias as SqlName, then in your SQL you can do:

select * from SqlName

and that gets data from MyDataSource.

OutputSchemas.documentation: Specifies the data schema for the SparkSQL transform.

SparkSQL.documentation: Specifies a transform where you enter a SQL query using Spark SQL syntax to transform the data. The output is a single DynamicFrame.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The data inputs identified by their node names.

Path.documentation: A path in Amazon S3 where the transform will write a subset of records from the dataset to a JSON file in an Amazon S3 bucket.

Topk.documentation: Specifies a number of records to write starting from the beginning of the dataset.

Prob.documentation: The probability (a decimal value with a maximum value of 1) of picking any given record. A value of 1 indicates that each row read from the dataset should be included in the sample output.

Spigot.documentation: Specifies a transform that writes samples of the data to an Amazon S3 bucket.

Name.documentation: The name of the transform node.

Inputs.documentation: The data inputs identified by their node names.

Paths.documentation: A JSON path to a variable in the data structure.

SplitFields.documentation: Specifies a transform that splits data property keys into two DynamicFrames. The output is a collection of DynamicFrames: one with selected data property keys, and one with the remaining data property keys.

From.documentation: A table, or a column in a table.

Alias.documentation: A temporary name given to a table, or a column in a table.

SqlAlias.documentation: Represents a single entry in the list of values for SqlAliases.

RoleArn.documentation: Specifies the IAM role used to create the workflow.

RunId.documentation: The run ID for this blueprint run.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the database where the table resides.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table to generate statistics.

ColumnNameList.documentation: A list of the column names to generate statistics. If none is supplied, all column names for the table will be used by default.

Role.documentation: The IAM role that the service assumes to generate statistics.

SampleSize.documentation: The percentage of rows used to generate statistics. If none is supplied, the entire table will be used to generate stats.

CatalogID.documentation: The ID of the Data Catalog where the table reside. If none is supplied, the Amazon Web Services account ID is used by default.

SecurityConfiguration.documentation: Name of the security configuration that is used to encrypt CloudWatch logs for the column stats task run.

ColumnStatisticsTaskRunId.documentation: The identifier for the column statistics task run.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the database where the table resides.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table for which to start a column statistic task run schedule.

Name.documentation: Name of the crawler to start.

DataSource.documentation: The data source (Glue table) associated with this run.

Role.documentation: An IAM role supplied to encrypt the results of the run.

NumberOfWorkers.documentation: The number of G.1X workers to be used in the run. The default is 5.

Timeout.documentation: The timeout for a run in minutes. This is the maximum time that a run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. The default is 2,880 minutes (48 hours).

DataQualitySecurityConfiguration.documentation: The name of the security configuration created with the data quality encryption option.

ClientToken.documentation: Used for idempotency and is recommended to be set to a random ID (such as a UUID) to avoid creating or starting multiple instances of the same resource.

StartDataQualityRuleRecommendationRunReq.documentation: The request of the Data Quality rule recommendation request.

RunId.documentation: The unique run identifier associated with this run.

DataSource.documentation: The data source (Glue table) associated with this run.

Role.documentation: An IAM role supplied to encrypt the results of the run.

NumberOfWorkers.documentation: The number of G.1X workers to be used in the run. The default is 5.

Timeout.documentation: The timeout for a run in minutes. This is the maximum time that a run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. The default is 2,880 minutes (48 hours).

ClientToken.documentation: Used for idempotency and is recommended to be set to a random ID (such as a UUID) to avoid creating or starting multiple instances of the same resource.

AdditionalRunOptions.documentation: Additional run options you can specify for an evaluation run.

AdditionalDataSources.documentation: A map of reference strings to additional data sources you can specify for an evaluation run.

RunId.documentation: The unique run identifier associated with this run.

TransformId.documentation: The unique identifier of the machine learning transform.

OutputS3Path.documentation: The Amazon S3 path where you export the labels.

TaskRunId.documentation: The unique identifier for the task run.

TransformId.documentation: The unique identifier of the machine learning transform.

InputS3Path.documentation: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) path from where you import the labels.

ReplaceAllLabels.documentation: Indicates whether to overwrite your existing labels.

TaskRunId.documentation: The unique identifier for the task run.

JobName.documentation: The name of the job definition to use.

JobRunQueuingEnabled.documentation:
Specifies whether job run queuing is enabled for the job run.

A value of true means job run queuing is enabled for the job run. If false or not populated, the job run will not be considered for queueing.

JobRunId.documentation: The ID of a previous JobRun to retry.

Arguments.documentation:
The job arguments associated with this run. For this job run, they replace the default arguments set in the job definition itself.

You can specify arguments here that your own job-execution script consumes, as well as arguments that Glue itself consumes.

Job arguments may be logged. Do not pass plaintext secrets as arguments. Retrieve secrets from a Glue Connection, Secrets Manager or other secret management mechanism if you intend to keep them within the Job.

For information about how to specify and consume your own Job arguments, see the Calling Glue APIs in Python topic in the developer guide.

For information about the arguments you can provide to this field when configuring Spark jobs, see the Special Parameters Used by Glue topic in the developer guide.

For information about the arguments you can provide to this field when configuring Ray jobs, see Using job parameters in Ray jobs in the developer guide.

AllocatedCapacity.documentation:
This field is deprecated. Use MaxCapacity instead.

The number of Glue data processing units (DPUs) to allocate to this JobRun. You can allocate a minimum of 2 DPUs; the default is 10. A DPU is a relative measure of processing power that consists of 4 vCPUs of compute capacity and 16 GB of memory. For more information, see the Glue pricing page.
AllocatedCapacity.deprecatedMessage: This property is deprecated, use MaxCapacity instead.

Timeout.documentation:
The JobRun timeout in minutes. This is the maximum time that a job run can consume resources before it is terminated and enters TIMEOUT status. This value overrides the timeout value set in the parent job.

Jobs must have timeout values less than 7 days or 10080 minutes. Otherwise, the jobs will throw an exception.

When the value is left blank, the timeout is defaulted to 2880 minutes.

Any existing Glue jobs that had a timeout value greater than 7 days will be defaulted to 7 days. For instance if you have specified a timeout of 20 days for a batch job, it will be stopped on the 7th day.

For streaming jobs, if you have set up a maintenance window, it will be restarted during the maintenance window after 7 days.

MaxCapacity.documentation:
For Glue version 1.0 or earlier jobs, using the standard worker type, the number of Glue data processing units (DPUs) that can be allocated when this job runs. A DPU is a relative measure of processing power that consists of 4 vCPUs of compute capacity and 16 GB of memory. For more information, see the Glue pricing page.

For Glue version 2.0+ jobs, you cannot specify a Maximum capacity. Instead, you should specify a Worker type and the Number of workers.

Do not set MaxCapacity if using WorkerType and NumberOfWorkers.

The value that can be allocated for MaxCapacity depends on whether you are running a Python shell job, an Apache Spark ETL job, or an Apache Spark streaming ETL job:

  • When you specify a Python shell job (JobCommand.Name="pythonshell"), you can allocate either 0.0625 or 1 DPU. The default is 0.0625 DPU.

  • When you specify an Apache Spark ETL job (JobCommand.Name="glueetl") or Apache Spark streaming ETL job (JobCommand.Name="gluestreaming"), you can allocate from 2 to 100 DPUs. The default is 10 DPUs. This job type cannot have a fractional DPU allocation.

SecurityConfiguration.documentation: The name of the SecurityConfiguration structure to be used with this job run.

NotificationProperty.documentation: Specifies configuration properties of a job run notification.

WorkerType.documentation:
The type of predefined worker that is allocated when a job runs. Accepts a value of G.1X, G.2X, G.4X, G.8X or G.025X for Spark jobs. Accepts the value Z.2X for Ray jobs.

  • For the G.1X worker type, each worker maps to 1 DPU (4 vCPUs, 16 GB of memory) with 94GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for workloads such as data transforms, joins, and queries, to offers a scalable and cost effective way to run most jobs.

  • For the G.2X worker type, each worker maps to 2 DPU (8 vCPUs, 32 GB of memory) with 138GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for workloads such as data transforms, joins, and queries, to offers a scalable and cost effective way to run most jobs.

  • For the G.4X worker type, each worker maps to 4 DPU (16 vCPUs, 64 GB of memory) with 256GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for jobs whose workloads contain your most demanding transforms, aggregations, joins, and queries. This worker type is available only for Glue version 3.0 or later Spark ETL jobs in the following Amazon Web Services Regions: US East (Ohio), US East (N. Virginia), US West (Oregon), Asia Pacific (Singapore), Asia Pacific (Sydney), Asia Pacific (Tokyo), Canada (Central), Europe (Frankfurt), Europe (Ireland), and Europe (Stockholm).

  • For the G.8X worker type, each worker maps to 8 DPU (32 vCPUs, 128 GB of memory) with 512GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for jobs whose workloads contain your most demanding transforms, aggregations, joins, and queries. This worker type is available only for Glue version 3.0 or later Spark ETL jobs, in the same Amazon Web Services Regions as supported for the G.4X worker type.

  • For the G.025X worker type, each worker maps to 0.25 DPU (2 vCPUs, 4 GB of memory) with 84GB disk, and provides 1 executor per worker. We recommend this worker type for low volume streaming jobs. This worker type is only available for Glue version 3.0 or later streaming jobs.

  • For the Z.2X worker type, each worker maps to 2 M-DPU (8vCPUs, 64 GB of memory) with 128 GB disk, and provides up to 8 Ray workers based on the autoscaler.

NumberOfWorkers.documentation: The number of workers of a defined workerType that are allocated when a job runs.

ExecutionClass.documentation:
Indicates whether the job is run with a standard or flexible execution class. The standard execution-class is ideal for time-sensitive workloads that require fast job startup and dedicated resources.

The flexible execution class is appropriate for time-insensitive jobs whose start and completion times may vary.

Only jobs with Glue version 3.0 and above and command type glueetl will be allowed to set ExecutionClass to FLEX. The flexible execution class is available for Spark jobs.

ExecutionRoleSessionPolicy.documentation: This inline session policy to the StartJobRun API allows you to dynamically restrict the permissions of the specified execution role for the scope of the job, without requiring the creation of additional IAM roles.

JobRunId.documentation: The ID assigned to this job run.

TransformId.documentation: The unique identifier of the machine learning transform.

TaskRunId.documentation: The unique identifier associated with this run.

TransformId.documentation: The unique identifier of the machine learning transform.

OutputS3Path.documentation: The Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) path where you generate the labeling set.

TaskRunId.documentation: The unique run identifier that is associated with this task run.

Name.documentation: The name of the trigger to start.
The name of the trigger that was started.
The name of the workflow to start.

RunProperties.documentation:
The workflow run properties for the new workflow run.

Run properties may be logged. Do not pass plaintext secrets as properties. Retrieve secrets from a Glue Connection, Amazon Web Services Secrets Manager or other secret management mechanism if you intend to use them within the workflow run.

RunId.documentation: An Id for the new run.

BatchWindow.documentation: Duration of the batch window in seconds.

StartingEventBatchCondition.documentation: The batch condition that started the workflow run. Either the number of events in the batch size arrived, in which case the BatchSize member is non-zero, or the batch window expired, in which case the BatchWindow member is non-zero.

StartedOn.documentation: The unix time and date that the job definition was started.

CompletedOn.documentation: The unix time and date that the job definition was completed.

Statement.documentation: The statement or request for a particular action to occur in a session.

Status.documentation: The status of the code execution output.

ErrorName.documentation: The name of the error in the output.

StatementOutput.documentation: The code execution output in JSON format.

TextPlain.documentation: The code execution output in text format.

StatementOutputData.documentation: The code execution output in JSON format.

StatisticRecordedOn.documentation: The timestamp when the annotated statistic was recorded.

InclusionAnnotation.documentation: The inclusion annotation applied to the statistic.

EvaluationLevel.documentation: The evaluation level of the statistic. Possible values: Dataset, Column, Multicolumn.

ColumnsReferenced.documentation: The list of columns referenced by the statistic.

ReferencedDatasets.documentation: The list of datasets referenced by the statistic.

RecordedOn.documentation: The timestamp when the statistic was recorded.

ViewValidations.documentation: A list of ViewValidation objects that contain information for an analytical engine to validate a view.

StatusDetails.documentation: A structure containing information about an asynchronous change to a table.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the database where the table resides.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the database where the table resides.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table for which to stop a column statistic task run schedule.

Name.documentation: Name of the crawler to stop.

CrawlerName.documentation: Name of the crawler whose schedule state to set.

Id.documentation: The ID of the session to be stopped.
Returns the Id of the stopped session.

Name.documentation: The name of the trigger to stop.
The name of the trigger that was stopped.
The name of the workflow to stop.

RunId.documentation: The ID of the workflow run to stop.

Columns.documentation: A list of the Columns in the table.

Location.documentation: The physical location of the table. By default, this takes the form of the warehouse location, followed by the database location in the warehouse, followed by the table name.

AdditionalLocations.documentation: A list of locations that point to the path where a Delta table is located.

InputFormat.documentation: The input format: SequenceFileInputFormat (binary), or TextInputFormat, or a custom format.

OutputFormat.documentation: The output format: SequenceFileOutputFormat (binary), or IgnoreKeyTextOutputFormat, or a custom format.

Compressed.documentation: True if the data in the table is compressed, or False if not.

NumberOfBuckets.documentation: Must be specified if the table contains any dimension columns.

BucketColumns.documentation: A list of reducer grouping columns, clustering columns, and bucketing columns in the table.

SortColumns.documentation: A list specifying the sort order of each bucket in the table.

SkewedInfo.documentation: The information about values that appear frequently in a column (skewed values).

StoredAsSubDirectories.documentation: True if the table data is stored in subdirectories, or False if not.

SchemaReference.documentation:
An object that references a schema stored in the Glue Schema Registry.

When creating a table, you can pass an empty list of columns for the schema, and instead use a schema reference.

StorageDescriptor.documentation: Describes the physical storage of table data.

RecordPollingLimit.documentation: The limit to the number of records polled.

StreamingDataPreviewOptions.documentation: Specifies options related to data preview for viewing a sample of your data.

MaximumLength.documentation: The size of the longest string in the column.

AverageLength.documentation: The average string length in the column.

NumberOfNulls.documentation: The number of null values in the column.

NumberOfDistinctValues.documentation: The number of distinct values in a column.

StringColumnStatisticsData.documentation: Defines column statistics supported for character sequence data values.

DialectVersion.documentation: The version of the dialect of the query engine. For example, 3.0.0.

SupportedDialect.documentation: A structure specifying the dialect and dialect version used by the query engine.

Name.documentation: The table name. For Hive compatibility, this must be entirely lowercase.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the database where the table metadata resides. For Hive compatibility, this must be all lowercase.

CreateTime.documentation: The time when the table definition was created in the Data Catalog.

UpdateTime.documentation: The last time that the table was updated.

LastAccessTime.documentation: The last time that the table was accessed. This is usually taken from HDFS, and might not be reliable.

LastAnalyzedTime.documentation: The last time that column statistics were computed for this table.

StorageDescriptor.documentation: A storage descriptor containing information about the physical storage of this table.

PartitionKeys.documentation:
A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

When you create a table used by Amazon Athena, and you do not specify any partitionKeys, you must at least set the value of partitionKeys to an empty list. For example:

"PartitionKeys": []

ViewOriginalText.documentation: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of Glue operations. If the table is a VIRTUAL_VIEW, certain Athena configuration encoded in base64.

ViewExpandedText.documentation: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of Glue operations.

TableType.documentation:
The type of this table. Glue will create tables with the EXTERNAL_TABLE type. Other services, such as Athena, may create tables with additional table types.

Glue related table types:

EXTERNAL_TABLE

Hive compatible attribute - indicates a non-Hive managed table.

GOVERNED

Used by Lake Formation. The Glue Data Catalog understands GOVERNED.

Parameters.documentation: These key-value pairs define properties associated with the table.

CreatedBy.documentation: The person or entity who created the table.

IsRegisteredWithLakeFormation.documentation: Indicates whether the table has been registered with Lake Formation.

TargetTable.documentation: A TableIdentifier structure that describes a target table for resource linking.

CatalogId.documentation: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the table resides.

FederatedTable.documentation: A FederatedTable structure that references an entity outside the Glue Data Catalog.

ViewDefinition.documentation: A structure that contains all the information that defines the view, including the dialect or dialects for the view, and the query.

IsMultiDialectView.documentation: Specifies whether the view supports the SQL dialects of one or more different query engines and can therefore be read by those engines.

Table.documentation: Represents a collection of related data organized in columns and rows.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table. For Hive compatibility, this must be entirely lowercase.

CatalogId.documentation: The ID of the Data Catalog in which the table resides.

DatabaseName.documentation: The name of the catalog database that contains the target table.

Name.documentation: The name of the target table.

TableIdentifier.documentation: A structure that describes a target table for resource linking.

Name.documentation: The table name. For Hive compatibility, this is folded to lowercase when it is stored.

Owner.documentation: The table owner. Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of Glue operations.

LastAccessTime.documentation: The last time that the table was accessed.

LastAnalyzedTime.documentation: The last time that column statistics were computed for this table.

StorageDescriptor.documentation: A storage descriptor containing information about the physical storage of this table.

PartitionKeys.documentation:
A list of columns by which the table is partitioned. Only primitive types are supported as partition keys.

When you create a table used by Amazon Athena, and you do not specify any partitionKeys, you must at least set the value of partitionKeys to an empty list. For example:

"PartitionKeys": []

ViewOriginalText.documentation: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of Glue operations. If the table is a VIRTUAL_VIEW, certain Athena configuration encoded in base64.

ViewExpandedText.documentation: Included for Apache Hive compatibility. Not used in the normal course of Glue operations.

TableType.documentation:
The type of this table. Glue will create tables with the EXTERNAL_TABLE type. Other services, such as Athena, may create tables with additional table types.

Glue related table types:

EXTERNAL_TABLE

Hive compatible attribute - indicates a non-Hive managed table.

GOVERNED

Used by Lake Formation. The Glue Data Catalog understands GOVERNED.

Parameters.documentation: These key-value pairs define properties associated with the table.

TargetTable.documentation: A TableIdentifier structure that describes a target table for resource linking.

ViewDefinition.documentation: A structure that contains all the information that defines the view, including the dialect or dialects for the view, and the query.

TableInput.documentation: A structure used to define a table.

type.documentation:
The type of table optimizer. The valid values are:

  • compaction: for managing compaction with a table optimizer.

  • retention: for managing the retention of snapshot with a table optimizer.

  • orphan_file_deletion: for managing the deletion of orphan files with a table optimizer.

configuration.documentation: A TableOptimizerConfiguration object that was specified when creating or updating a table optimizer.

lastRun.documentation: A TableOptimizerRun object representing the last run of the table optimizer.

configurationSource.documentation: Specifies the source of the optimizer configuration. This indicates how the table optimizer was configured and which entity or service initiated the configuration.

TableOptimizer.documentation: Contains details about an optimizer associated with a table.

roleArn.documentation: A role passed by the caller which gives the service permission to update the resources associated with the optimizer on the caller's behalf.

vpcConfiguration.documentation:
A TableOptimizerVpcConfiguration object representing the VPC configuration for a table optimizer.

This configuration is necessary to perform optimization on tables that are in a customer VPC.

compactionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for a compaction optimizer. This configuration defines how data files in your table will be compacted to improve query performance and reduce storage costs.

retentionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for a snapshot retention optimizer.

orphanFileDeletionConfiguration.documentation: The configuration for an orphan file deletion optimizer.

TableOptimizerConfiguration.documentation: Contains details on the configuration of a table optimizer. You pass this configuration when creating or updating a table optimizer.

eventType.documentation: An event type representing the status of the table optimizer run.

startTimestamp.documentation: Represents the epoch timestamp at which the compaction job was started within Lake Formation.

endTimestamp.documentation: Represents the epoch timestamp at which the compaction job ended.

metrics.documentation:
A RunMetrics object containing metrics for the optimizer run.

This member is deprecated. See the individual metric members for compaction, retention, and orphan file deletion.
metrics.deprecatedMessage: Metrics has been replaced by optimizer type specific metrics such as IcebergCompactionMetrics

error.documentation: An error that occured during the optimizer run.

compactionMetrics.documentation: A CompactionMetrics object containing metrics for the optimizer run.

compactionStrategy.documentation:
The strategy used for the compaction run. Indicates which algorithm was applied to determine how files were selected and combined during the compaction process. Valid values are:

  • binpack: Combines small files into larger files, typically targeting sizes over 100MB, while applying any pending deletes. This is the recommended compaction strategy for most use cases.

  • sort: Organizes data based on specified columns which are sorted hierarchically during compaction, improving query performance for filtered operations. This strategy is recommended when your queries frequently filter on specific columns. To use this strategy, you must first define a sort order in your Iceberg table properties using the sort_order table property.

  • z-order: Optimizes data organization by blending multiple attributes into a single scalar value that can be used for sorting, allowing efficient querying across multiple dimensions. This strategy is recommended when you need to query data across multiple dimensions simultaneously. To use this strategy, you must first define a sort order in your Iceberg table properties using the sort_order table property.

retentionMetrics.documentation: A RetentionMetrics object containing metrics for the optimizer run.

orphanFileDeletionMetrics.documentation: An OrphanFileDeletionMetrics object containing metrics for the optimizer run.

TableOptimizerRun.documentation: Contains details for a table optimizer run.

glueConnectionName.documentation: The name of the Glue connection used for the VPC for the table optimizer.

TableOptimizerVpcConfiguration.documentation:
An object that describes the VPC configuration for a table optimizer.

This configuration is necessary to perform optimization on tables that are in a customer VPC.

RequestedBy.documentation: The ARN of the user who requested the asynchronous change.

UpdatedBy.documentation: The ARN of the user to last manually alter the asynchronous change (requesting cancellation, etc).

RequestTime.documentation: An ISO 8601 formatted date string indicating the time that the change was initiated.

UpdateTime.documentation: An ISO 8601 formatted date string indicating the time that the state was last updated.

Action.documentation: Indicates which action was called on the table, currently only CREATE or UPDATE.

State.documentation: A generic status for the change in progress, such as QUEUED, IN_PROGRESS, SUCCESS, or FAILED.

Error.documentation: An error that will only appear when the state is "FAILED". This is a parent level exception message, there may be different Errors for each dialect.

Details.documentation: A StatusDetails object with information about the requested change.

TableStatus.documentation: A structure containing information about the state of an asynchronous change to a table.

Table.documentation: The table in question.

VersionId.documentation: The ID value that identifies this table version. A VersionId is a string representation of an integer. Each version is incremented by 1.

TableName.documentation: The name of the table in question.

VersionId.documentation: The ID value of the version in question. A VersionID is a string representation of an integer. Each version is incremented by 1.

key.documentation: The tag key. The key is required when you create a tag on an object. The key is case-sensitive, and must not contain the prefix aws.

value.documentation: The tag value. The value is optional when you create a tag on an object. The value is case-sensitive, and must not contain the prefix aws.

Tag.documentation:
The Tag object represents a label that you can assign to an Amazon Web Services resource. Each tag consists of a key and an optional value, both of which you define.

For more information about tags, and controlling access to resources in Glue, see Amazon Web Services Tags in Glue and Specifying Glue Resource ARNs in the developer guide.

ResourceArn.documentation: The ARN of the Glue resource to which to add the tags. For more information about Glue resource ARNs, see the Glue ARN string pattern.

RoleArn.documentation: The IAM role to access the Glue database.

KmsArn.documentation: The ARN of the KMS key used for encryption.

ConnectionName.documentation: The Glue network connection to configure the Glue job running in the customer VPC.

EventBusArn.documentation: The ARN of an Eventbridge event bus to receive the integration status notification.

TargetProcessingProperties.documentation: The resource properties associated with the integration target.

CatalogArn.documentation: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the catalog resource.

TargetRedshiftCatalog.documentation: A structure that describes a target catalog for resource linking.

TargetResourceNotFound.documentation: The target resource could not be found.

UnnestSpec.documentation: Specifies how nested objects are flattened to top-level elements. Valid values are: "TOPLEVEL", "FULL", or "NOUNNEST".

PartitionSpec.documentation: Determines the file layout on the target.

TargetTableName.documentation: The optional name of a target table.

TargetTableConfig.documentation: Properties used by the target leg to partition the data on the target.

TaskRunId.documentation: The unique identifier for this task run.

Status.documentation: The current status of the requested task run.

LogGroupName.documentation: The names of the log group for secure logging, associated with this task run.

Properties.documentation: Specifies configuration properties associated with this task run.

ErrorString.documentation: The list of error strings associated with this task run.

StartedOn.documentation: The date and time that this task run started.

LastModifiedOn.documentation: The last point in time that the requested task run was updated.

CompletedOn.documentation: The last point in time that the requested task run was completed.

ExecutionTime.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) that the task run consumed resources.

TaskRun.documentation: The sampling parameters that are associated with the machine learning transform.

Status.documentation: The current status of the task run.

StartedBefore.documentation: Filter on task runs started before this date.

StartedAfter.documentation: Filter on task runs started after this date.

TaskRunFilterCriteria.documentation: The criteria that are used to filter the task runs for the machine learning transform.

ImportLabelsTaskRunProperties.documentation: The configuration properties for an importing labels task run.

ExportLabelsTaskRunProperties.documentation: The configuration properties for an exporting labels task run.

LabelingSetGenerationTaskRunProperties.documentation: The configuration properties for a labeling set generation task run.

FindMatchesTaskRunProperties.documentation: The configuration properties for a find matches task run.

TaskRunProperties.documentation: The configuration properties for the task run.

Column.documentation: The column to be used to sort the list of task runs for the machine learning transform.

SortDirection.documentation: The sort direction to be used to sort the list of task runs for the machine learning transform.

TaskRunSortCriteria.documentation: The sorting criteria that are used to sort the list of task runs for the machine learning transform.

ConnectionType.documentation: The type of connection to test. This operation is only available for the JDBC or SALESFORCE connection types.

ConnectionProperties.documentation:
The key-value pairs that define parameters for the connection.

JDBC connections use the following connection properties:

  • Required: All of (HOST, PORT, JDBC_ENGINE) or JDBC_CONNECTION_URL.

  • Required: All of (USERNAME, PASSWORD) or SECRET_ID.

  • Optional: JDBC_ENFORCE_SSL, CUSTOM_JDBC_CERT, CUSTOM_JDBC_CERT_STRING, SKIP_CUSTOM_JDBC_CERT_VALIDATION. These parameters are used to configure SSL with JDBC.

SALESFORCE connections require the AuthenticationConfiguration member to be configured.

AuthenticationConfiguration.documentation: A structure containing the authentication configuration in the TestConnection request. Required for a connection to Salesforce using OAuth authentication.

TestConnectionInput.documentation: A structure that is used to specify testing a connection to a service.

ConnectionName.documentation: Optional. The name of the connection to test. If only name is provided, the operation will get the connection and use that for testing.

CatalogId.documentation: The catalog ID where the connection resides.

TestConnectionInput.documentation: A structure that is used to specify testing a connection to a service.

RecordedBefore.documentation: The timestamp before which statistics should be included in the results.

RecordedAfter.documentation: The timestamp after which statistics should be included in the results.

LastModifiedOn.documentation: The timestamp when the inclusion annotation was last modified.

Name.documentation: Specifies the name of the parameter in the config file of the dynamic transform.
